column4: One more thing, is there a way in which I can customize the applications which are going to be installed on the system during installation, like in old days ?
but I have a live cd which installs ubuntu 11.10 in GNOME version....  can I use that to customize because I dont have mini cd
mini isn't a mini cd.  You'd download the ISO, burn it to a disk, boot and customize.  the iso is only  a few hundred megabytes
yeah I know but it would be expensive for me to download 600MB or more data ...that is likely to cost about $5 .... for something which I already have free on disc
11.10 is 23 mb.  You've probably expended that much data just in this irc...
, lol yeah I have no probs downloading mini cd which is 26MB for me but after downloading it when I would start installing, it will download over 600MB of packages...  which will cost
install the default, then sudo apt-get purge the packages you DON'T want?
and how does that help ? I will still have to download about 600MB of data which I already have on free disc
is your system mobile?  laptop?
.. yup
coffeshop wifi
, ok now thats a good suggestion if you live in usa, unfortunately I live in India .... :\
and here coffeeshops dont offer free wifi :\ ..... we are 3rd world country as far as mobile internet connection is concerned
sorry.  your user ID logs you in in Corvalis, Oregon, USA...:(
school/college internet connection?
from where ????? how is that possible ? no idea... .. may be because of proxy server
where are you in india?  maybe we can locate an ubuntu loco.
nope ...office has internet but we are not allowed to carry personal digital equipments there ....  :|
I live in suburb region near country's capital ...so not sure if you can find one in my small town
#ubuntu-in
also http://www.ubuntu-in.info/
and https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-in
AND contacts@ubuntu-in.info
thnx
